textBox.richText: Facial recognition techniques are currently deployed in a wide range of applications for access control, security, law-enforcement and database indexing, to cite a few.   As in any other field of Biometrics such as speaker or fingerprint verification, 2-D facial recognition systems are subject to attacks. In direct attacks, potential intruders try and may gain access to classified information by interacting directly with the system input cameras, like a normal user would. Such attempts are commonly referred as "spoofing". For this competition we would like to measure the performance of algorithms that act as a counter-measure to spoofing. You are invited to submit your technique for evaluation. Competition on counter measures to 2D facial spoofing attacks International Joint Conference on Biometrics 2011 11th to 13th of October 2011  (http://www.cse.nd.edu/IJCB_11/),  Washington DC, USA More information at http://www.tabularasa-euproject.org/evaluations/ijcb-2011-competition-on-counter-measures-to-2d-facial-spoofing-attacks This work is sponsored by the FP7 TABULA RASA project.
IJCB 2011 Competition on counter measures to 2D facial spoofing attacks
